Review: Overall this is great value for money. I've got sensitive skin and have been trying to find something which packs a moisture punch, but light enough to be used every day and is affordable. This is about the top range of what I was looking to spend and it's proper value for money. My skin feels softer after applying, without it feeling heavy - I can even take a second coat a few minutes later if my skin is feeling particularly dry. One surprising thing is the gorgeous subtle smell, a lovely luxurious cherry on the top! The only tiny downside (which is probably fair for the price), is that it does take a little while to settle into the skin. The first couple of times I was using it, my skin was pink. At first I thought itmight be the product itself, but then I realised I was rubbing it in a little too hard (seriously, my skin is that sensitive it notices). I'm now being gentler so it's stopped causing redness, but you do have to have a couple minutes patience. Overall though it's great, and I'm sticking with it.

Review: This review will compare this aloe vera gel to the leave on primer by nuface for use with the microcurrent device. I have been using nuface for a few months now. I have generally used it with the 'official' primer. Aloe vera gel is a great go-to option. I have used it with this gel a handful of times and I can state what I have noticed. Firstly, it requires a bit more product than the other gel because this aloe vera gel starts to 'dry' faster so a thicker layer is required so that it continues to 'glide.¬†Secondly, I noticed that this aloe vera moisturising gel is 98% aloe vera. In the past I have only used 99% formulations (for aftercare for laser, etc.) While I will say there is not much of a difference; this product tends to be less 'sticky' when applied in a thick layer and from what I have experienced, does not start to make thos white flakes, etc. In my opinion, this makes it better to use on the face in general. It can act as a product on the face on its own to some extent as it is 'moisturising' and hasnt 'dried up' in my experience. I will note that I have only ever left this on for 10 - 20 minutes so I don't know what happens afterwards but I doubt it will flake. Importantly, I cannot comment on how effectively it conducts the electric current from the device. I can say however, that I am confident enough in it personally to rely on this gel a few times a week to make my nuface gel go further as I do believe it is likely a comparable conductor. This is just my opinion, however. (I am a scientist, but I am not a physicist so I would not like to claim to know more than I truly do, particularly about a fairly new technology like these at-home devices.) :)¬†Third. In terms of the packaging, it is fine and almost the same as the nuface gel in terms of how much product comes out with a squeeze. Although one is not travelling as much nowadays, I will note that my nuface gel in the smallest bottle was 59ml. (Back in early 2020 - pre-march) I was able to carry this in my hand luggage without a problem even though the limit is usually 50ml. Maybe I was just fortunate - both ways. But the point I make is that it is a smaller more travel easy bottle. Regarding the aloe vera gel, while the bottle is definitely not large (only a but bigger honestly), the volume of tis written in grams and ounces. So from a quick search that seems to be. 118ml (And looks right.) So it's not a carry on size necessarily but it is small enough for a journey where you can check your luggage, train, etc. For sure. Additionally, the tube has a matte finish. Its a pleasant tube and is just as shown.Finally, I will mention it doesnt get as 'tight' as some aloe ver gels. I spot tested this in order to write this review. It does end up with an ever so slightly tacky feeling. But i feel like this is a bit less than other, organic, aloe vera gels I have tired in the past. All in all it is a good product but seeing as I bought it for a specific reason I thought I might write this review based on the use I purchased it for. In my opinion I will continue to alternate between the original gel and this nice Aloe vera gel. Even using a greater amount of product, it works out a lot more financially expedient than the original Nuface gel which costs a lot more per ml.¬†Hope I helped someone! Happy new year. :)¬†

But the point I make is that it is a smaller more travel easy bottle. Regarding the aloe vera gel, while the bottle is definitely not large (only a but bigger honestly), the volume of tis written in grams and ounces. So from a quick search that seems to be. 118ml (And looks right.) So it's not a carry on size necessarily but it is small enough for a journey where you can check your luggage, train, etc. For sure. Additionally, the tube has a matte finish. Its a pleasant tube and is just as shown.Finally, I will mention it doesnt get as 'tight' as some aloe ver gels. I spot tested this in order to write this review. It does end up with an ever so slightly tacky feeling. But i feel like this is a bit less than other, organic, aloe vera gels I have tired in the past. All in all it is a good product but seeing as I bought it for a specific reason I thought I might write this review based on the use I purchased it for. In my opinion I will continue to alternate between the original gel and this nice Aloe vera gel. Even using a greater amount of product, it works out a lot more financially expedient than the original Nuface gel which costs a lot more per ml.†Hope I helped someone! Happy new year. :)†

Review: Believe the hype... this really is magic! Excellent for any areas of dry skin (including pretty bad eczema). Has an amazing overnight healing effect on chapped lips too. Be warned though, it‚Äôs on the greasier side of the spectrum (I‚Äôd call it more of an ointment than a cream per se). But that‚Äôs why it works so well I think. I‚Äôve been slathering it on my foot (with bad eczema) 2-3 times a day and it‚Äôs made a big difference. My husband also uses it for dry patches around the eye area and it‚Äôs worked fantastically (and very quickly). Love that it‚Äôs natural and has a fairly minimal ingredients list. Great for dry knuckles too from all the COVID hand washing. Only warning is that because it‚Äôs a bit greasy, I wouldn‚Äôt use it on my face in the day (don‚Äôt think make-up would sit well over the top). Also, to protect my carpet and sheets when I put it on my foot at night, I wear a cotton spa sock which also helps to lock in the moisture.

Review: I originally bought this in the supermarket but have been hooked on it ever since. It's extremely wallet friendly, but doesn't feel cheap or greasy when you put it on, and has a clean, fresh, citrusy smell. Since having to wear a mask at work all day, I was getting the occasional spot, so I've taken my skin a little more seriously. In combination with a good exfoliator (I used Murad's), a toner (Pixi glow tonic is the best!), a serum (the Ordinary's super cheap and amazing Nicotinamide and Zinc serum has been a life saver), and finally this moisturiser, within days my skin's never looked better, and feels so healthy. I can't recommend this product enough.

I still find I need something else over the top because it is just not enough to wake up with glowing skin. I started using this product at night time, combined with face oils and I definitely need moisturizer under my sunscreen at day time. It plays well with makeup and didn't pill. It does feel good on my face, but I am not sure if it could do more than my previous night time moisturizer, the CeraVe PM moisturizer. Both had very similar effects on my skin, both texture seems the same, neither make my skin greasy, neither too heavy or thick, both contains niacinamide, so I would appriciate something extra... Overall I guess this is a pretty normar moisturizer with a bit of a higher price tag. I can't say if I will repurchase this again.

Review: Small backstory about my skin - I've always had eczema and stupidly applied steroid creams to my face over a long period of time, since cutting the steroid creams out I've had dry/combo skin, prone to acne and prone to perioral dermatitis (not fun!) I have to be extremely careful with the products I use as most things break me out or lead to perioral dermatitis.This cream is my saviour, I've been using it for around 4 months now. It has never broken my out of irriated my skin whatsoever. It's very light, but a beautifully soothing day cream. It's not the most hydrating out there, but works perfectly in the day and I use a thicker / more hydrating cream at night.When my perioral dermatitis flares I only use this cream until it's healed. If I can put this directly on perioral dermatitis without experiencing any sensitivity then I think anyone can use this cream!

Review: I decided to give this brand a try since I've heard so many incredible things about it online, what a mistake! I really really really tried to make it work, I bought this moisturiser together with the Q10 serum and I gave it about a month and a half to have its possible reaction and then calm down. I did the patch test the night before my first use and nothing was wrong in the first 2-3 days. But after a week my face was just full of tiny bumps and whiteheads! Nothing else in my routine has changed - diet, sleep, stress levels, other skincare products or increased usage of make up. I did not change anything in my routine but adding those two products to my skincare. And the result was horrible.. As a huge fan of the Ordinary and all kinds of clean and basic skincare I wanted this to work so bad, but was unfortunately left scared to try anything else from this brand..

Review: I first came across this cream as a sample tube in one of my LF Beauty Box subscription boxes.  I used the sample cream daily after running out of my usual moisturiser.  After a couple of weeks of using it, I noticed my skin appeared clearer and its tone more even, it also felt lovely and smooth.  I have combination skin and suffer with the occasional breakout, but using this cream remedied any oiliness and I didn't suffer a breakout at all while using it.  I was truly gutted when my sample tube ran out, and believe me I used every last drop of it, even going as far as cutting the end off the tube, easily another few days' worth left in there!  I never thought I'd ever spend as much on a face cream, but a little really does go a very long way; it's such a light, creamy, almost gel-like formula.  It smooths on effortlessly, it really does, it's like silk and it has given me confidence in my skin I haven't had in a very long time.  As for the anti-wrinkle side of things, I'll update you on that when I buy my next pot!  If you're on the fence about the cost of it, as I was, all i can say is go for it, your skin will thank you for it.

Review: I was recommended this moisturiser by a dermatologist. I was suffering from acne and put on a routine of oral and topical antibiotics, tretinoin (prescription retinol/vitamin A) as well as this moisturiser.¬†I have since stopped the use of antibiotics and my skin has cleared, this product however has stayed. I would say I have normal but reactive/sensitive skin, that sometimes suffers from acne breakouts, that can also get quite dry from the vitamin A use if I use too often.¬†After two years of use, this is by far one of my staple products that I can‚Äôt go without. It‚Äôs never broken me out, I like the consistency and I love the fact it has probiotics to help with the skin‚Äôs flora.I use this AM & PM. In the Am I apply just to dry skin, I don‚Äôt wash my face, then sunscreen over the top. In the PM during the summer I apply to damp skin after cleansing and in winter I apply hyaluronic acid to damp skin, then this over the top, just to give some extra hydration.¬†It‚Äôs pricey for the amount you get, so I recommend buying in bulk when there‚Äôs sales on.¬†Truly a great moisturiser.

I would say I have normal but reactive/sensitive skin, that sometimes suffers from acne breakouts, that can also get quite dry from the vitamin A use if I use too often.†After two years of use, this is by far one of my staple products that I can't go without. It's never broken me out, I like the consistency and I love the fact it has probiotics to help with the skin's flora.I use this AM & PM. In the Am I apply just to dry skin, I don't wash my face, then sunscreen over the top. In the PM during the summer I apply to damp skin after cleansing and in winter I apply hyaluronic acid to damp skin, then this over the top, just to give some extra hydration.†It's pricey for the amount you get, so I recommend buying in bulk when there's sales on.†Truly a great moisturiser.

Review: I used to suffer from acne and have been looking for lightweight yet effective moisturizer which does not leave my skin oily or tight, gives the right moisture boost and calms down irritated and sensitive skin. After using this vaccine for a while I noticed changes - my skin was softer, hydrated and my acne starts going away. Now, after 4 months, I am completely without acne. It was definitely caused by mixed factors but this vaccine has definitely helped my skin to heal and recover. I would recommend for any skin type if you are looking for a simple, effective and just a dreamy moisturizer. Even for oily types of skin because it never leaves your skin with excess amount of oil. Already finished all bottle and will definitely buy another one soon.

There's hardly any redness to face (apart from the sore bits). I'm extremely happy.

Review: In all honesty, you've probably done what I did initially and thought "snail moisturiser?!" But I promise you the product is good!I have dry, acne prone skin (yay) and since January my jawline, and cheeks have been AWFUL (maskne is probably making it worse too). Oil based moisturisers weren't helping (I used to love ny lait creme concentre) so after much research I settled on this one as part of my new nighttime routine.I would say the consistency is closer to a gel than a cream, but it absorbs so well, even after my niacinamide, hyaluronic and rose oil. It doesn't pile and if you feel you need a little more moisture, you can always pop a little more on. I can easily put some lait creme concentre on top where my skin is extremely parched and it's no bother. I would recommend this.

I would really recommend this cream but it definitely needs to be applied liberally to get optimum results.

I found the smell pleasant not over powering or lingering at all.. if you don‚Äôt like perfumed scents or rose scented products in particular be aware. Every great review I‚Äôve seen is for the shade sunny flash only, but usually you assume the same product in a different shade will be the same product.. just a different shade, however it‚Äôs not- there is no colour to this serum it‚Äôs just shimmer so I‚Äôm unable to wear alone there‚Äôs no¬†coverage or colour which is what I wanted and hoped for after reading reviews. I‚Äôm disappointed as you assume the product is the same but lighter in colour? There is no colour..therefore it has different uses (which I feel should be marked in the product description that this shade provides no colour)¬†if you‚Äôre looking for a nice shimmer as a base only this is good, if you‚Äôre looking for an alternative to foundation as so many of the reviews suggested get the sunny flash and just hope the shade isn‚Äôt too bronzed for fair skin? It‚Äôs a shame they don‚Äôt have smaller versions to test so you don‚Äôt waste your money.¬†

Review: I was really hesitant to try this, given that it‚Äôs a lot pricier than my usual go to gradual tan but I‚Äôd heard so much hype I thought i would try it out. First of all I was a bit disappointed with the amount of product for the price, but soon discovered how little you need to get a great looking colour. The glass bottle is very sleek and chic and not something I mind having displayed on my dresser. I‚Äôve found that for me the best way to use this is to ‚Äòtop up‚Äô my usual bondi sands tan 1-2 days after the initial application. I use 6 pumps on each leg, the same for arms and then 2 pumps for my chest and 2 for my back and I find that this gives me a lovely glow and colour and helps to stop my tan fading or patching as quickly. I‚Äôve found that I can easily get around 10 days before I need to remove all the tan and start again. It also scrubs off really easily with very little effort so you don‚Äôt have to make yourself red raw when you want to remove it and start again. The product goes on clear and develops pretty quickly. I‚Äôve not had any issues with transfer or staining on clothes or sheets, however the skin can feel slightly tacky for a few hours after application. I‚Äôve had a couple of disasters with staining in between fingers but you just really need to scrub your hands clean after application. I would buy this product again, but maybe only when there‚Äôs a discount available as it is still pricey for what I‚Äôm using it for.

Review: I‚Äôm a huge Super Glow fan, I suffer from hyperpigmentation, and have a fake tan phobia (=fear of tango orange streaks), Super Glow is more skincare than fake tan so I couldn‚Äôt wait for Super Glow Body. To be honest it took a few weeks to be able to give a balanced view. But I will say I never once found it left me streaky. I did find my body drank it up and I used a lot in 2 weeks. But I don‚Äôt moisturise my body, and I realised my skin just desperately needed the boost. My skin now feels incredible, and i had enough of a glow to dare to bare on the beach this weekend (in a bikini üòâ). I love this product, and am recommending it to everyone.

Review: I'm pretty fair, and it's not a flattering look on skin. I'm not the most fair person, more like fair-light, and when I'm in the sun I do tan. I love this product so much. I'm terrified of self tanner because I'm a mom to a little child and do not have the time to make sure I apply things flawlessly. This goes into the skin very quickly, and it is gradual. I can do my whole body in about 7-8 minutes. I wouldn't say it makes me look "tanned", but just glowy and takes the edge off of being so white. It makes my skin look healthy and pretty, and not pale... which is all I could ask for to be honest. There is a super slight smell throughout the day (but I am very sensitive to smells). I don't even feel I need to add moisturizer after application, but I do add some body oil the next day. Works very well. I've already repurchased to stock up. I think this is going to become a staple for pretty skin year-round.

Review: My new favourite. I've seen other brands advertise with older women explaining hyaluronic acid as the ultimate anti-ageing product of the moment and wasn't interested. With Sanctuary's product I felt more inclined to try it. They don't focus just on the anti-ageing aspect. They mention protecting the complexion against pollution (which all ages are exposed to), 24 hours hydration (which is always useful!) and radiance-enhancing properties (who doesn't want to look radiant?). The added bonus of anti-ageing is nice. I like how it is so smooth and silky and you really don't need more than a couple of drops. I can see this lasting a long time! It soaks in very quickly, doesn't burn or tingle and smells lovely! Despite being called an oil serum it doesn't clog my pores, affect my oily skin or break me out in spots. In fact, I felt that it helped to get rid of some of the excess oil that my face produces.Not tested on animals - very important! :D

Review: Thanks Lookfantastic for great offers and quick delivery!About my skin. I have a sensitive skin, dry at places, normal to oily T-zone. Can't use oils in my routine as they clog the pores. I'm sensitive to aloe vera, as well.Good points: very light texture, doesn't leave greesy feeling, although slightly sticky to start with but absorbs quickly. My skin didn't break out.Now, coming to the rest. The dropper applicator - it's not very good, not easy to get the last drops out of the bottle, wouldn't call it very hygienic also, I think pump would be more suitable for this type of product. It's not economical either, it took me about 2 months! to use it all. I haven't noticed extra hydration and my lines haven't changed. In fact my under eye area seems to be drier and fine wrinkles got more visible. To the end of the bottle I started to get burning sensation around my eyes.So, for the money you pay you would expect much more. Could probably suit other skin type as there are some rave reviews about this product.As for me, really dissapointed, money wasted.

But this means purchasing another bottle and it's way overpriced. The ingredients it contains i.e. niacinamide and tranexamic acid can be found in other brands which are much more affordable. I will say however that I experienced no irritation and I found that this product was at least slightly more effective than the Phloretin CF serum which is a hoax. For you reference, I am Asian with combination skin that is somewhat sensitive.

Review: I've never before felt compelled to review a product, but this serum has had magical effects on my combination/extremely sensitive/couperose-prone skin. I received a sample size (10ml, which is a nice amount) with a previous order on Lookfantastic, and I started using it during a time of utter desperation (I'm being dramatic!), as my skin was acting out and making me unhappy. I loved it so much that I just HAD to buy the full size bottle.I'm probably a bit younger than the target demographic for the "Keep Young and Beautiful" series of products, but, while I don't drink or smoke or abuse my skin in any significant way, I do work from 9AM to 11PM, 5 days a week, in front of a computer screen, getting basically no sun or air, which leads to a tired, washed out-looking skin.The Instant Firming Beauty Shot promises to "lift and plump up the skin, increase elasticity and fight the visible signs of ageing," and that's precisely what it does (well, not sure about the "fighting the signs of ageing" bit yet, but you get the point). As soon as it's been applied, the skin feels (and looks) nice and taut, but not in an unpleasant way! Quite the opposite. I generally apply it after I spritzed (is that a word? English isn't my first language, I apologize!) a floral water, while the skin is still "wet," and I find both the application and result just lovely. But what's truly remarkable for me is the effect the serum has on my couperose. I have no idea which of its ingredients (or combination of them) is responsible for it, BUT THANK YOU, DEAR SIR. The redness is much less noticeable to the eye now, while the tiny bumps (similar to "chicken skin") have almost entirely disappeared. The broken capillaries are still there, of course, I doubt there's anything to do about them, but considering that I haven't been using this product for my couperose‚Äînor it's being sold as such, I'm still very happy with what it does. It's a significant addition to the aforementioned benefits!Obviously I can't vouch it will give the same result to another person afflicted with such a skin condition, but I can see myself repurchasing this serum again and again.

Review: I switched to pre-cleansing as a way of trying to sort my oily skin. I'd been alternating Pixi Glow and Glam Glow clay cleasners, but over time I realised they were ruining my skin. My skin look haggared dull and it was really oilly. I switched to this oil and dermalogica special cleanser. I noticed the difference in the way my skin felt within a couple of days. After 3 weeks my skin doesn't feel like an oil slick anymore, it's a lot less greasy and more balanced. This oil is the best I've used, it actually removes make up in one go and maybe a bit more for mascara but other products are not as effective. I do recommend this approach, especially if you have oily skin -- after a few weeks it should fix the problem.

Review: I bought the tiny bottle to try it out; my skin instantly loved it. Now I‚Äôm nearly at the end of my 70ml bottle. It really does make a difference to your skin and gives it a lovely smooth velvety look by cleaning out the impurities on your face. I was afraid that I would break out as my skin is very sensitive however, I haven‚Äôt broken out once. The trick is to rub it into your skin for 1 minute after, one minute add some water to your palms then rub into skin for a further 1 minute. Review: Quick overview of me, I have very sensitive skin and am extremely pale. For me any fake tan with DHA causes an itchy red rash that can be very uncomfortable. This product certainly doesn't do that. Following the instructions on the bottle it does take a long time to build up colour. I initially started using a few drops in my moisturiser to build up colour. As a newbie tanner I did not want the awful orange look. If you do this method you won't see results. Very quickly I realised you need to moisturise before, let it dry and then put the tanning oil on. If you use this method it takes about 3 days of constant use (putting on every night and sleeping in it) to see colour. By the third day I did have a lovely natural glow. It isn't a dark tan like normal tanning products but rather a sun kissed, day at the beach glow which is what I was aiming for. You do need more than you think, I would say a good 6/7 drops on each arm, leg and main body.The downside to the product is the fact that the oil is not fast absorbing. It takes a LONG time to soak into the skin and you need to wear clothes to bed that you don't mind it rubbing off on. The first time I applied the oil for 3 days it started to rub off on my white bed sheets. Once you've applied it, you need to give yourself a good 30 minutes if not longer to allow it to try and soak into the skin before dressing. Even then you will feel it moving on your on skin and onto your clothes. Saying that it still produced a nice colour.The tan starts to naturally fade after about 3/4 days. If you don't scrub in the shower or with a towel and only pat dry then the tan doesn't move or cause any patches. Also moisturising after each shower really helps this tan maintain its colour. The only other frustration with this product is how easily it comes off on a sports bra and socks. If you're someone like me who works out often then this might be a deciding factor. I started to notice after only the second day of having the tan that It had worn off and left patches where my sports bra would be and around the ankle area where my socks would be. This causes a big contrast in colour and can be quite noticeable with sandals or a low cut top on. Just something to consider. Overall if you have super sensitive skin like me and want something to give you a glow throughout the summer months then this is the product for you. Just be mindful of the lengthy application process and when you're sweaty it could rub off.

Review: Have been using this sporadically since I purchased it in April however I'm not convinced it is for me.I have combination, congested skin and I have used many types of oil on my face without any problem however this gave me mixed results.I tended to use it at night or during the day when I was home having a make up free day. I agree that it leaves skin soft, supple and relaxed but I am not convinced that it calms my complexion or eases any of the acne congestion. In fact, I suffered a major breakout the first time I used it though this may well be coincidental. Also, irrespective of how little I use, I found it rarely absorbed fully and there was always quite a bit left on my skin. Whilst this certainly helped my skin glow, I did not like the feel. I read  that you need exfoliated skin to ensure that facial oils absorb properly and so I tried this as well but I still found that absorption was an issue. I have since switched to Balance Me's Rose Otto Face Oil which is far more suitable for my skin needs. It is lighter, it smells divine and it absorbs beautifully leaving little trace on the skin. It also works wonders with my skin calming any redness and congestion and gives me nice glow which has led to many positive comments. I still use a drop or two of the Radiance Face Oil from time to time instead to see whether it reacts better with my calmer skin but I still find it does not absorb as well, leaves a greasy sheen on my skin and causes congestion.

Review: I've been using this for years now and feel like its been a big influence in transforming my skin. At night, after cleansing & toning my combination skin, I apply 3 drops into this mixed with Estee Lauder's ANR. My skin feels, hydrated, balanced and nourished without feeling overloaded with product. I also use this as a stand alone product and its performs amazingly! I perform a weekly glycolic acid peel at 10% strength and put 5 drops of this amazing product on after it. My skin remains calm, balanced and moisturised and not at all irritated. I also use it on any dry patches, including touches of dermatitis, as well as over anything that has the potential to scar (healed blemishes, cuts, even stretch marks) and its had a miraculous effect on healing my skin. I chemically burned my skin a while aog and this luxurious oil helped with healing in as little 3 weeks. I went from blisters to zero scarring or even redness. I can't recommend this product enough!

Review: I received this oil yesterday and yesterday already knew, that would write a review to this product.I am 41 and very well remember a photo I got from a cosmetologist when I was maybe 20 y.o., a photo of my under-epidermis skin layers, showing up some lines on my skin, looking-like dried out Sakhara rivers, which I was told were the signs of skin dehydratation.I am a very skincare person, a good skin is one of my all-time personal goals, but whatever I've been doing all the 20 years since the photo, those lines always with me.Till yesterday, literally!I got this oil, replaced with it almost all my pre-bed skin routine and then simply could not stop using it and make myself finally go to slip. It was like pointing targets on cheeks where else I see a sign of dehydratation and adding oil there. It took only about 10 minutes to see the great difference. The elasticity of skin is times better, it really looks younger and of course hydrated. I am obsessed, want to try all the line, the oils especially.I 100% recommend this oil, if you, maybe like me, looking at your aging skin and don't want letting it's good condition go, recommend this purchase absolutely. Don't want to discuss the price, but I feel it will stay a long time, as when on the packaging the say "drops" - they mean it and you won't need much (if you can stop adding it everywhere on your face )).Loved it! The best skin care for me now, couldn't been happier.

Review: I bought this while it was on offer as the price mark is so high. This mist comes in a pretty bottle and smells beautifully, albeit a bit too strong. What bothers me about this is the aggressive pump. It's more a spray than a mist, which means it covers a very small area meaning I have to spray multiple times to cover the entire face (as opposed to just a couple of sprays other mists need) and I find it sprays so harshly that I am having to spray it on my hands then pat my face rather than doing it directly on the face. I haven't been using it long so can't speak for any benefits yet, but at least it hasn't irritated my skin.TL;DR - There are better mists out there for a fraction of the price. Not worth it unless you just want to add a pretty bottle to your collection.

Review: Like a lot of the other reviews, after over using prescription retinol I googled ‚Äúhow to repair my skin barrier‚Äù and ended up on this product. I already have oily and acne skin but after over using retinol my face was tight and sore and I knew I‚Äôd caused damage because my face was pouring with oil! When I read the reviews I thought I bet it doesn‚Äôt work and everyone just has dry skin and that‚Äôs why they think it‚Äôs a miracle cream! However after using this twice a day for 2 days, I‚Äôve noticed a massive difference already! The first day I woke up and no difference but the second day I woke up and saw that my oiliness looks like it has rebalanced and my skin doesn‚Äôt feel sore to touch! So I can confirm even if you‚Äôre acne/oily and have overdone it on the actives then I‚Äôve just used my normal cerave foaming cleanser for first cleanse, cerave hydrating cleanser for second cleanse, rose water for my toner, hyaluronic acid, cerave pm moisturiser and then this balm over the top and took it right back to basics and my skin is thanking me for it! I think I‚Äôll use this balm for a while to restore my skins moisture but also makeup went amazing over the top of it!

The first day I woke up and no difference but the second day I woke up and saw that my oiliness looks like it has rebalanced and my skin doesn't feel sore to touch! So I can confirm even if you're acne/oily and have overdone it on the actives then I've just used my normal cerave foaming cleanser for first cleanse, cerave hydrating cleanser for second cleanse, rose water for my toner, hyaluronic acid, cerave pm moisturiser and then this balm over the top and took it right back to basics and my skin is thanking me for it! I think I'll use this balm for a while to restore my skins moisture but also makeup went amazing over the top of it!

Review: Beautifully packaged, the balm comes with an applicator and a cloth. The applicator is very handy as it allows you to dip into the balm and apply to face all while preventing bacteria from mixing with it. Review: This balm is amazing as a first cleanse or am cleanse. It has the consistency of the elemis cleansing balm but with a few slightly rougher bits in. This gives the feeling of a mild exfoliation. It leaves your skin feeling smooth, soft and clean without it feeling tight or stripped. I absolutely love Balance Me products and this is no different. My skin is super super sensitive and dry/eczema prone and I can use this product anywhere on the face without it irritating my skin.¬†

Review: I really liked this cleansing balm. I chose it because I was looking to try something different to the usual high price tag cleansing balms i usually buy. The consistency is quite thick to begin with, almost difficult to squeeze out of the tube. But then i slightly warm between my fingers and start to massage into my skin. I have no issues with the effectiveness of removing / dissolving my makeup, it smells amazing, the only thing I'm not sure about is the grainy texture of it. Initially i really enjoyed the grainy texture as it gave a good polish to my skin, however I'm not certain i want to have a kind of scrub on my face every single day. My skin can be quite sensitive and i don't think could take the grainy texture daily, so I've actually been using it a few times a week, instead of every night. Still deciding if i will repurchase...

Review: I originally had a mini in an advent calendar last year and loved it, used it throughout the year as a lip balm. I bought this full size as I loved it so much and as both myself and my daughter are eczema sufferers so wanted it to hand to try. This is amazing, the back of my daughter's (9) hands are feeling dead, dry, rough, red, itchy and aggravated from eczema triggered by the school using hand sanitizer on her twice a day (not the one we use for more sensitive skins). I planned to call the GP tomorrow morning for a prescription, smothered Dr PawPaw over her hands, covered with sandwich bags and put socks over them. I have just taken them off 3 hours 15 mins later as she had pulled one off in her sleep and her hands feel amazing and smooth. We have been plastering her hands with moisturisers day and night and no brands have helped. We are stunned with the results and her dad is now going to buy a tube for his house tomorrow due to the results. Highly recommend!

Review: I bought this after reading some reviews for it and i purchased the Evercalm set too. My skin is extremely sensitive to everything and i suffer with eczema, extremely dry, sore skin with acne thrown in too! Having got my acne under better control i thought i'd try to nourish and try to desensitise my face so bought this. I love this balm, it's like silk on your skin and leaves my face supersoft, moisturised without being greasy and much less red and sensitive. Before using REN Evercalm products everything would trigger either an allergic reaction or my eczema to flare up especially now the weather is colder and the heating is on, but, my skin now looks 10x better without any dry patches or resembling someone who has been in the sun all day. If you're thinking of trying it give it a go, it honestly helps me.

Review: I left it on for 1.5 hours and rinsed as instructed. It then took around 4/5 days for the first peeling to begin. It didn't peel off all in one go, it was a process over around 3 days. But it's been a week since and my feet are still super smooth and looking much better. :)

Review: Since working out seriously and regularly at home I was looking for something extra - also to compensate for not seeing my beautician ...Well, in general I am not a fan of sheet masks: - Something that can really be avoided re. eco finger print- Might be great for adventurous teens/twens with skin that forgets/forgives- nothing for the 40+    beauty nerd  - Let's face it, often weird ingredients, additives, etc. I would not dream to expose my skin to - Poor value / not economicalThat note for all out there over 40 who would not consider buying something like that!Here is the result after using this one over the weekend: AMAZING!!! - Really deep cleanses (and I am convinced double cleanser)- Skin glows SERIOUSLY, pores better than I thought could get- Not harsh / not stripping skin- No feeling of 'weird ingredients sitting on top of skin afterwards- Anti-ageing claim - yep, skin looks super fabI am seriously impressed and will ABSOLUTELY add this to my must-haves.By the way: Invited (should say forced) hubby to try mask after I did. It was still foaming away and full of liquid. He hated the feel of something wet and 'slimy' on his face (lol - typical men) but boy, his skin got a fab deep clean!! He has the most sensitive skin with flaky outbreaks so that says it all.If 10 mask came in a glass pot now I'd give it 10 stars!

Review: I have combination blemish prone skin and suffer from hyperpigmentation, and have noticed that using this product during a flare up significantly reduces the inflammation and scarring. Great pick me up if you want to give your skin that extra boost of moisture, suppleness and brightness and can also be applied on other areas of the skin like tops of the hands, feet and decolletage! It doesn't exactly sink in all the way and feels a little bit like honey once it doesn't settle into the skin, so it can feel sticky but it's well worth the results. I keep mine in the fridge for an extra cooling effect and apply at night, and also reuse the left over serum in the packet for another day as a night time serum! Overall great product for an amazing price!

Review: I naturally have oily skin which has become very dry recently, due to my overuse of actives for cystic acne. I can't comment on the hydrating effects of this, as I use it as an overnight mask in my final step, after a thick moisturiser (and i cant imagine it would be that moisturising on its own, being a medium-thin cream).However, I am so impressed by its effects on my skin tone! I have medium-dark skin and my face is covered in hyperpigmentation from years of acne struggles. After just a couple weeks use, my scars are drastically faded, my overall complexion is a lot more even and brighter (not 'whiter'). An amazing product! Review: I purchased this mask after reading positive reviews online. It's a high-end product which looks and feels very luxurious. It comes in a pretty cardboard box - good to see recyclable packaging which is something we should all be looking for. The product itself comes in a hexagonal glass jar with a brown screw lid - in fact it looks rather like a jar of honey. It should be applied with the metal spatula provided in the box, which you can store on the lid thanks to the magnetic lid - a really clever piece of design. The mask looks just like sticky honey when applied, but massage it into your skin for a few moments and it turns into a white, creamy mask which feels warm on the skin. I found it relaxing and soothing once on. After using for the first time, my skin felt well-hydrated, smooth and bright. I have been applying this mask on average twice a week and notice an improvement in skin texture and pore size. A great product, worth the investment in my opinion.

The mask looks just like sticky honey when applied, but massage it into your skin for a few moments and it turns into a white, creamy mask which feels warm on the skin. Review: I wanted to try some new products and they had an offer 0f -50% so I tried 3 of them. It leaves the skin really clean and quite smooth especially when you use it in combination with the scrub. I noticed that it refines my pores and reduce their sizes. It dries easily so you don't have to wait for ages to remove it and works quite well. I use it 1-2 times a week as stated in the instructions and I am very pleased.Also, it is very easy to apply (I use a brush). If you use it in combination with other masks at the same day like another clay etc mask it can dry your skin out and cause irritation. I am applying it also on my bf and his skin looks better too and it is so soft. I would recommend it but do use it with caution and make sure you apply serum and a moisturizer afterwards as it takes all the oil from the skin.

Review: The first time I used this my skin was extremely dry and irritated from acne medication, and I thought this smelled lovely and did a great job of clearing my pores. However, since coming off my medication I have used this twice and on both occasions it has left my skin bright red and swollen, and caused my skin to break out in a dry, flaky rash within an hour of washing it off. I have no idea why this has happened since coming off my medication, especially as my skin was far more sensitive whilst I was taking it. The only thing I can think of is that because my skin was already in such a bad state, I just didn't notice that the mask wasn't compatible with it.  Regardless, I won't be using this again as the painful rash was only healed with use of hydrocortisone twice a day for over a week.

I'm mainly comparing it to the sensation immediately after the body shop tea tree oil mask, for example,  where it feels like your skin can breathe again after use. This one felt relaxing when it was on, but didn't feel anything immediately after.

Review: I really love this cleanser - I was lucky to purchase the Omorovicza beauty box from Look Fantastic which contained this product. I also use the Elemis cleansing balm which is equally as effective at a much better price.  In fact the Elemis balm is a lot easier to remove than this as it foams up much better when you add water.In short I really do like this balm, I feel I am treating my skin when I use it, but I just could not justify the price when there are equally good products on the market which are also a premium brand but significantly cheaper.

Review: I wanted a black peel off mask for my t-zone since I have my pores have been looking horrible lately and I have had success in the past with peel off masks. I decided to go with Garnier because I have been really loving the brand lately (I am using their Miscelar water to remove my makeup and I have had 0 complaints, I use their sheet masks very often and I also use their makeup removing wipes, though I will stop using them for environmental purposes once this packet is done). I have used this product three times, once per week because I just don't have time for self-care. BUT my pores have been looking significantly better.I do use this product in conjunction with my skin care routine, which is done both morning and night, but my t-zone is not the reason for my skin care. I do believe that this product really does help with the pores.Caution - the first time I did it, I applied a very thin layer and it was kind of a fail. Just make sure you get a medium consistency for this mask so it is a) easy to peel off and, b) effective. You'll get so much satisfaction seeing what the mask pulls from your skin... it's amazing. 5/5

I give this a shot on the recommendation of my facialist, who said that it was light but very effective. For me it is the perfect mask. Slap it on, leave it for 10 minutes (my skin drinks most of it up) and then tissue off the excess. I do this before I go to bed so I can sleep on it and wash it off thoroughly in my morning skincare routine. It leaves my skin plump, even and glowing with NO irritation or breakouts. La roche posay is 100% my favourite skincare brand.

Review: This was quite a considered purchase for me, but I am really glad I took the plunge.  The peel has a light gel consistency and a citrussy scent (though this is not very noticeable) and you apply to your face and decolletage and leave for up to an hour.  It spreads really easily, without any dragging, and you don't need very much at all for a complete application, so a jar actually lasts for quite a while, using once or twice a week, as a result.  The gel seems to absorb somewhat, so when you come to wash it off, there appears to be far less product than you applied, and it washes off really easily - no need for scrubbing.  Best of all are the results - my skin looked much brighter after the first time I used it, and by using the peel regularly, I find these results have maintained really well.  I don't get any tingling when I use this product, but I use a lot of very active skin care: I suspect, if you have sensitive skin, this will probably be too strong for you to leave on for very long.  In all honesty, though, I haven't noticed a difference in results, whether I leave it on for ten minutes or an hour, so this shouldn't impact too much whilst you build up your tolerance.  This is a lovely product to use, and has really lovely results as well.

The peel has a light gel consistency and a citrussy scent (though this is not very noticeable) and you apply to your face and decolletage and leave for up to an hour.  It spreads really easily, without any dragging, and you don't need very much at all for a complete application, so a jar actually lasts for quite a while, using once or twice a week, as a result.  The gel seems to absorb somewhat, so when you come to wash it off, there appears to be far less product than you applied, and it washes off really easily - no need for scrubbing.  Best of all are the results - my skin looked much brighter after the first time I used it, and by using the peel regularly, I find these results have maintained really well.  I don't get any tingling when I use this product, but I use a lot of very active skin care: I suspect, if you have sensitive skin, this will probably be too strong for you to leave on for very long.  In all honesty, though, I haven't noticed a difference in results, whether I leave it on for ten minutes or an hour, so this shouldn't impact too much whilst you build up your tolerance.  This is a lovely product to use, and has really lovely results as well.

Review: I use this on my face twice a week in combination with various other products from The Ordinary to amazing affect. However, I recently had great success in using it to treat keritosis pilaris (red bumps on the upper arms).Since puberty (I'm now 30) I have had keritosis pilaris on my upper arms and shoulders and I gave up long ago on trying to eliminate it. I recently read that lactic acid can be beneficial to reduce the signs of KP, and as I already own this product I thought I would give it a try. I've been applying a few drops to the affected area twice a week for about a month, and the difference is phenomenal! I can't remember the last time the tips of my arms were this clear and smooth!Remember - you must use SPF when using this product, so please remember to wear sunscreen whenever you are outdoors!

I recently read that lactic acid can be beneficial to reduce the signs of KP, and as I already own this product I thought I would give it a try. I've been applying a few drops to the affected area twice a week for about a month, and the difference is phenomenal! I can't remember the last time the tips of my arms were this clear and smooth!Remember - you must use SPF when using this product, so please remember to wear sunscreen whenever you are outdoors!

Easy to discount this theory by rubbing some on the lid of the packaging.  No balling or pilling ocurrs. Also I've noticed on the odd occasion when I've used it every other day very little skin comes off but if you use if occasionally lots comes off.  So ignore the nay sayers.  This works and is amazing particularly if like me your skin is too sensitive for exfoliators but skin needs a helping hand to renew quicker.

Review: I have always had troubles with under my eyes, you name it I have it. I started to notice how delicate the area was getting and the skin under the eye was starting to really become thin and saggy so creating wrinkles and a droop. I hated taking my makeup off as I could feel my skin stretching and worsening. Makeup was settling in the bags and lines and I started to feel like an old lady. I'm 34. I had read about the serum and sounded perfect, an eye serum to firm up that area. I have used a lot of creams and nothing has worked. Well after one week my under eye feels completely different. It feels firmer, more resilient and using this alongside the cream I am absolutely over the moon with the results after such a short amount of time. It has also helped reduce the puffiness. Yes it's expensive but I think absolutely worth it.

Review: Despite being a gel, it absorbes well and leaves a silky touch, making it a perfect make-up base as it reduces friction. It is also perfume-free (I've read differently on another review, but I don't perceive any scent), which is great on my sensitive eyes.That being said, my dark circles and wrinkles are still there. I wasn't expecting any effectiveness on that to be honest, but I always hold a secret tiny hope that creams would eventually do what they say. This is not the case (or any others', for that matter). I just find it a bit annoying that brands keep on claiming effects they do not have (hence the 3 stars). This is a great moisturising product gentle on the delicate eye contour area - let's stick to this description (which would win it 5 stars).

Usually my skin is pretty good so this was not good.. I thought I'd get this and the toner to go with it, to ensure super clean lovely skin-  ritually using it day and night. To absolutely no avail.I've also been using a clay mask midweek to try and get those pores clean but no, nothing, in factI noticed today that I actually have EVEN MORE pimples than before. So here I am again, looking for an alternative.Good if your skin is good anyway.. but not to reignite beautiful dreamy 5***** skin

Review: I purchased this after reading a recommendation in a magazine recently - a Beauty Editor's recommendation no less - and had to give it a try as my skin has always looked so dull and I suffer from redness and the odd breakout. I've never found a face cleanser that I'm really happy with. My skin is typically combination, oily chin, nose and forehead and dry cheeks. This stuff is amazing and so worth the price! It is an oil, but isn't greasy at all. It glides onto the skin and once lathered up you can really feel your skin getting a good clean. I read a tip - double-wash, to first remove makeup and then to give the skin an extra deep clean once the makeup has been removed. Since I've been using this (along with the toner) my skin is visibly brighter, less red and I've had no breakouts. It is so gentle yet amazing at removing makeup, even eye makeup! Absolutely love this and will purchase again (but not for a while as it is lasting ages!!!)

Review: First off, I rarely write reviews.  Secondly, I have purchased and wasted quite a bit of money on skincare. In a few days, my facial skin has transformed.  I'm waking up in the morning amazed my skin actually looks and feels pretty decent.  That is a big statement for me since I usually dread looking at my skin in the morning.  Anyway, I have already placed another order so I can give some away to my friends & family for stocking stuffers this x-mas.  I am writing this review because I know how much it sucks to worry about your complexion and hopefully this product will help someone else.

Review: I've never written a review for anything. But I feel that I have to for Erno Laszlo. I've had hormonal acne for about 5 years and struggled with finding something that would help with breakouts while keeping my skin hydrated. This Phelityl cleansing bar along with the pre-cleansing oil is amazing. I first massage the oil onto my face while I run hot water in the skin. Then I wet the soap and rub all over my face. I create a lather and massage for a minute or two. When rinsing it's important to do the splashing technique for 30 splashes with the treatment water (oil and soap water) and then 10 splashes of running hot water. I then follow up with the light controlling lotion (which seems like it would dry your skin but doesn't). After that I put on the hydra serum and then night cream. This routine morning and night along with monthly facials with steam and extraction, as well as a healthy diet has really helped me out. I do break out but at a fraction of what I used to get. I highly recommend this!!

Review: This baby arrived the other day and literally couldn't wait to try it out. It was a toss up between buying the Nourish or Glow scrub as both looked great but as my skin can be sensitive, this one was better suited.I used to use St Ives apricot scrub but find it too abrasive and harsh on my sensitive skin not to mention the microbeads are bad for the environment. This scrub has a pleasant chocolatey scent (subtle, not overpowering) with a buttery consistency which melts down once you rub it into your skin. The Glow L'oreal scrub has bigger sugar grains whereas the grains in this Nourish scrub are finer but still do a great job at removing dry skin. Leaves your skin feeling lovely and soft to touch :) I didn't have to use much to cover my whole face either so this jar should last awhile. Unless I'm imagining it, my skin looks a little 'brighter' since using this which is always a plus!If you have dry, sensitive skin like mine, this is worth a try. I recommend this product and would definitely re-purchase

Review: Never used a 'luxury' body wash before as I didn't really see the point. However, when my room mate left this little treat in the shared bathroom, I decided to help myself lol... Fair to say it smells and feels a lot better than anything I've used before.  Doesn't leave my skin dry like a bog-standard body wash, and now I don't need to use as much deodorant haha. So I decided to buy my own bottle and haven't looked back.To be honest, I was surprised - I'd defo recommend it, but maybe try a different scent and let me know how it is so I know which one to get next!Who knew I'd actually be writing about body wash?!? #21stcenturyman

Review: I purchased a Jo Malone set containing Pomegranate Noir body & hand wash (3.4 fluid oz/ 100ml), and body creme (1.7 fluid oz/ 50mls).I've tried a few different Jo Malone fragrances but Pomegranate Noir remains my favourite! JM products are always high quality. The fragrance of both the body wash and cream last all day. Hardly any body wash is required to produce a really luxurious lather, and the cream absorbs easily into the skin without feeling heavy or greasy. So, although they're quite expensive for the size, a little goes a long way so they're well worth the money. They arrived in the usual beautiful JM gift box including the black ribbon with bow. A JM gift bag was also included - all in perfect condition because they were packaged so well. So if you're thinking about buying this as a gift for someone it arrives exactly as if you'd bought it from a JM shop. I'm really happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend it to others.

Review: Gorgeous products at a reasonable price point for that little bit of spa luxury at home. I have tried several products in the range (body wash, bath oil, hand cream, room scent and candles) and I have been impressed with all so far. The packaging is nice too. The discount is an added bonus. My only gripe is that gift bags and boxes are not available through LF and whilst you can get them through head office they are chargeable plus postage which I think needs addressing! Most luxury brands give packaging FOC these days or at least build it into the pricing structure. It would be good if samples were offered in this range to try before committing to a full sized product.

Review: This product is amazing. If you are someone that suffers from anxiety/insomnia/stress, this product is for you. I describe this product as a sedative. It will calm you down and help you sleep. You only need one cap full in a bath (add it to the water once the bath is run) if you don't have time for a bath you can apply it to your body before getting into a warm/hot shower. If you don't have time for a shower, you can use it on your pulse points when you go to bed to get a better night sleep. Yes, it's a more costly product but as a beauty therapist of 17 years you normally get what you pay for and this product is totally worth it. Think I am in my 3rd bottle. I have put friends, my dad, and my friends dad on to this product to help them sleep.

Yes, it's a more costly product but as a beauty therapist of 17 years you normally get what you pay for and this product is totally worth it. Think I am in my 3rd bottle. I have put friends, my dad, and my friends dad on to this product to help them sleep.

Review: After receiving a time freebie with a store bundle a while ago, I have been hankering after some Aromatherapy Associates bath and shower oil for a while. The scent cocktails are truly amazing.You won't be disappointed with this one its just what I needed. I do practice mindfulness in the bath for 'me time' and these oils really make it a spa like experience. After working late till 3am and up for clients at 9am I really wanted a booster. Having received this through the door this morning, I made time to test it out. It was so beautiful. A bath on a cold winter's morning with this fresh and deeply comforting oil was dreamy. This is definitely a day or morning smell.I found that pouring in the recommended capful provides a strongly scented bath time experience and when poured under the hot water it releases lots of scent. The stream rising from the bath was heavenly.  Its very cheery as well as fortifying. With green freshness as well as some citrus it really wakes up the senses. I used it with some small amounts of pure almond oil and vitamin E oil in the bath for my skin and it was very soft afterwards.Totally indulgent. I really think if you wanted to you could be frugal with it and use perhaps half to 3/4 of a capful to get even more than the recommended 20 capfuls from it. It was nice to also see a clean bath, no lingering oily residue and it seems to be a pure product with high quality oils. Also worth mentioning is the packaging. The glass bottle and the box it arrives in is also stunning. It would make a gorgeous present and looks lovely in the bathroom. Highly recommended this may become a little addictive! Buy it you'll love it. I have ordered two alternatives from the range to also try, more for relaxation in the evening, I was that impressed with it.
